intro: Fornicium, commonly known as the "false hellebore," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ranunculaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are herbaceous perennials with showy, often yellow or greenish flowers that bloom in early spring. Fornicium species have simple, alternate leaves that are usually palmately lobed. They are typically found in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
